data.text: @Claude519982161 @greg_travis There are other things though, apart from dying. #LongCovid that can end up as #ME.
@JHowardBrainMD @karenvaites @greg_travis More kids will now die from the flu in the absence of mask mandates.  And they'll claim that makes them right. 🤦

@greg_travis Oh my it's like Ding scaremongering BS. How many kids die with covid not of ? How many tested for flu compared to covid ? Get real and off the money making scaremongering anti-science agenda.
@greg_travis What science is that ? LOL agendas are over.
@piercedgeek @greg_travis Which sounds to me like using it as a  comparison to previous seasons which is precisely what the disclaimer says not to do due to variables.

@piercedgeek @greg_travis Hmm...are you a bot because I don't recall saying that covid tests showed positive because of flu, but bots are accustomed to bringing up points they think are good points on key word subjects.

@mbobbish @greg_travis The chart just shows testing for the flu continued, the opposite of what is claimed as the reason it disappeared ("we stopped testing"). We continued testing, at higher rates actually.

@mbobbish @greg_travis Soo... Flu tests that worked fine for all the seasons before suddenly stop working for the first time, and also a test designed for a different virus DOES work for flu instead? And that makes more sense than.. a novel virus was dominant, okie dokie. Good night then

@piercedgeek @greg_travis I suppose there is always this disclaimer that they tacked on, which essentially says not to use this chart the way that you did.

My guess would be so that if someone is able to collect data from other sources to show how it is misrepresented here, they avoid any responsibility. https://t.co/tlBe91O5tJ
